item.title: What's Up Those Baseball Sleeves? Lots Of Data, And Privacy Concerns
item.description: August 30, 2017 - Professional athletes use wearable technology to improve performance. But key questions remain over who owns the data and how the information is used.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - Professional athletes use wearable technology to improve performance. But key questions remain over who owns the data and how the information is used. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/30/547062884/whats-up-those-baseball-sleeves-lots-of-athletes-data-and-concerns-about-privacy

item.title: Thinking Of Running For Office? A Website Lets You Test The Waters
item.description: August 30, 2017 - Think you may want to run for public office? A new site lets you crowdfund a potential campaign. See how a California congressional candidate was inspired to give it a try.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 30, 2017 - Think you may want to run for public office? A new site lets you crowdfund a potential campaign. See how a California congressional candidate was inspired to give it a try. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/30/546061687/thinking-of-running-for-office-a-website-lets-you-test-the-waters

item.title: Uber Ends Its Controversial Post-Ride Tracking Of Users' Location
item.description: August 29, 2017 - The practice caused immediate privacy concerns when the ride-hailing company added it in November. Users will regain the option to choose to share location data with the app only when using it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 29, 2017 - The practice caused immediate privacy concerns when the ride-hailing company added it in November. Users will regain the option to choose to share location data with the app only when using it. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/29/547113818/uber-ends-its-controversial-post-ride-tracking-of-users-location

item.title: After Pressure Mounts, Joel Osteen Says His Houston Megachurch Is Open To Evacuees
item.description: August 29, 2017 - Lakewood Church occupies an arena that used to house the Houston Rockets. Questions had circulated online about why it wasn't being used to house those needing refuge from Hurricane Harvey.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 29, 2017 - Lakewood Church occupies an arena that used to house the Houston Rockets. Questions had circulated online about why it wasn't being used to house those needing refuge from Hurricane Harvey. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/29/547035773/after-pressure-mounts-joel-osteen-says-his-houston-megachurch-is-open-to-evacuee

item.title: How Moldy Hay And Sick Cows Led To A Lifesaving Drug
item.description: August 29, 2017 - The blood thinner warfarin, which prevents blood clots, owes its existence to some cows who got very sick after eating spoiled hay — and to a chemist who spent years trying to figure out why.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 29, 2017 - The blood thinner warfarin, which prevents blood clots, owes its existence to some cows who got very sick after eating spoiled hay — and to a chemist who spent years trying to figure out why. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/29/531749974/how-moldy-hay-and-sick-cows-led-to-a-life-saving-drug

item.title: Facebook, Twitter Replace 911 Calls For Stranded In Houston
item.description: August 28, 2017 - Facebook and Twitter became de facto centers for thousands of stranded people as 911 centers became overwhelmed with calls. Police and officials are using social media as an essential tool to connect.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 28, 2017 - Facebook and Twitter became de facto centers for thousands of stranded people as 911 centers became overwhelmed with calls. Police and officials are using social media as an essential tool to connect. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/28/546831780/texas-police-and-residents-turn-to-social-media-to-communicate-amid-harvey

item.title: The News And Your Newsfeed
item.description:
August 28, 2017 - Do Facebook's partnerships with news organizations make it part of the media?
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-08-28/the-news-and-your-newsfeed
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 28, 2017 - Do Facebook's partnerships with news organizations make it part of the media? http://the1a.org/shows/2017-08-28/the-news-and-your-newsfeed

item.title: How Silicon Valley Is Shaping The News
item.description:
August 28, 2017 - Tech giants could soon replace traditional media publishers. Are we ready for social media to be the "mainstream media"?
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-08-28/how-silicon-valley-is-shaping-the-news
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 28, 2017 - Tech giants could soon replace traditional media publishers. Are we ready for social media to be the "mainstream media"? http://the1a.org/shows/2017-08-28/how-silicon-valley-is-shaping-the-news

item.title: Expedia's Dara Khosrowshahi Picked As Uber's New CEO
item.description: August 28, 2017 - After a search that included a number of well-known candidates, the board of ride-sharing giant Uber has announced its pick for CEO: Expedia's CEO Dara Khosrowshahi.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 28, 2017 - After a search that included a number of well-known candidates, the board of ride-sharing giant Uber has announced its pick for CEO: Expedia's CEO Dara Khosrowshahi. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/28/546668876/expedias-dara-khosrowshahi-picked-as-ubers-new-ceo

item.title: What The Public Is Saying About Miscarriage In 140 Characters
item.description: August 27, 2017 - Miscarriage, while widely experienced, is not often discussed in public. Researchers have turned to social media to see what people are saying about the topic and how much they're choosing to share.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 27, 2017 - Miscarriage, while widely experienced, is not often discussed in public. Researchers have turned to social media to see what people are saying about the topic and how much they're choosing to share. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/27/542809414/what-the-public-is-saying-about-miscarriage-in-140-characters

item.title: Why Don't We Have Princess Leia Holograms Yet?
item.description: August 26, 2017 - Researchers continue to chase down the sci-fi holy grail of genuine free-standing holograms — and they're getting pretty close. One obstacle: Current computing systems just aren't up to it.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 26, 2017 - Researchers continue to chase down the sci-fi holy grail of genuine free-standing holograms — and they're getting pretty close. One obstacle: Current computing systems just aren't up to it. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/08/26/546084473/why-don-t-we-have-princess-leia-holograms-yet

item.title: Human Rights Watch Raises Concerns Over Autonomous Weapons
item.description: August 26, 2017 - NPR's Scott Simon talks to Bonnie Docherty, senior arms researcher at Human Rights Watch, about the group's call for a pre-emptive ban on fully autonomous weapons.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 26, 2017 - NPR's Scott Simon talks to Bonnie Docherty, senior arms researcher at Human Rights Watch, about the group's call for a pre-emptive ban on fully autonomous weapons. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/26/546323236/human-rights-watch-raises-concerns-over-autonomous-weapons

item.title: Will Samsung Case Mark A Turning Point For South Korean Business Ties To Government?
item.description: August 25, 2017 - After Lee Jae-yong's conviction for bribery, "I hope this is a starting point to cutting off businesses' close relationship to the government," said South Korean President Moon Jae-in's spokesman.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 25, 2017 - After Lee Jae-yong's conviction for bribery, "I hope this is a starting point to cutting off businesses' close relationship to the government," said South Korean President Moon Jae-in's spokesman. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/08/25/546041137/will-samsung-case-mark-a-turning-point-for-south-korean-business-ties-to-governm

item.title: YouTube Stars Stress Out, Just Like The Rest Of Us
item.description: August 24, 2017 - Young YouTube stars work hard to look authentic and accessible, and they can make millions of dollars doing it. But the pressure to appear perfect while living online can sometimes be too much.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 24, 2017 - Young YouTube stars work hard to look authentic and accessible, and they can make millions of dollars doing it. But the pressure to appear perfect while living online can sometimes be too much. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/24/545552788/youtube-stars-stress-out-just-like-the-rest-of-us

item.title: Tanzania Gears Up To Become A Nation Of Medical Drones
item.description:
August 24, 2017 - Drones have delivered everything from pizza to condoms to hot dogs. In Tanzania, they have a bold new mission.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/24/545589328/tanzania-gears-up-to-become-a-nation-of-medical-drones
